page.title: 03Children's Games
page.content: The majority of children's games are outdoor.Kerby is played by throwing a ball against a kerb and then catching it for points.Elastics is where two children secure a loop of elastic around there ankles into which other children jump and manouevre.Stokey is a group form of hide and seek.British Bulldog has the objective of getting from one end of an alloted space to the other without being caught.The younger children also play communal games such as "tick" where one child chases another.They clap hands with each other to the rhythm of nursery rhymes and play "hand stands". These are only a few examples of children's games and although they seem simple, a great deal of pleasure is derived from them.
